headline: Alejandro Garnacho posts cryptic message after being snubbed by Erik ten Hag again
body: Alejandro Garnacho has been forced to play a substitute role in Man United's first two games this season and thought he had put his side ahead against Brighton - only to see his effort chalked off for offside

Manchester United star Alejandro Garnacho insisted "God has something planned for me" in a cryptic post after being left out of the starting XI by Erik ten Hag once again in their 2-1 loss to Brighton.

The Argentine has been forced to play a substitute role in both of United's first two games this season, playing the final 30 minutes against Fulham and the Seagulls - assisting Joshua Zirkzee's late winner against the former at Old Trafford.

But his late salvo wasn't enough to give him a starting spot against Brighton and he was unable to affect the game before Joao Pedro nodded in a dramatic header for Fabian Hurzeler's side in stoppage time.

Earlier in the game Garnacho did think he had put the Red Devils ahead in the 69th minute - moments after coming on - when he tapped home from Bruno Fernandes' ball across the face of goal, but in a strange turn of events the goal was chalked off for offside after Zirkzee got in the way of the shot as it crossed the line.

Garnacho was clearly devastated and couldn't hide his frustrations after the game - having been snubbed by Ten Hag then agonisingly having the goal taken away from him as he posted a message on social media platform X.
Posting a picture of himself celebrating his offside goal against Brighton, he wrote: "God has something planned for me, trust the process."
Before the game, Ten Hag had spoken out about Garnacho's potential after being asked by a journalist if he thought the player was "world class".

"You have gone very quickly," Ten Hag responded. "World-class is something where he has to go a long way. He has a high potential, 100 per cent. But last season he contributed and he can be a starting-XI player.
"It starts with hard work. That has brought him to where he is now and that will bring him to being a world-class player because I agree he has the potential."
The Dutchman urged him to "show" he deserves more starts, insisting he was "very pleased" with the impact he made against Fulham, along with goalscorer Zirkzee.
Garnacho enjoyed an impressive season with United last season and was one of the bright sparks amid a difficult campaign, scoring nine times and providing four assists.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Erik ten Hag opens up on Jadon Sancho decision amid sensational Chelsea tip
body: The summer transfer window slams shut at the end of the month, and Manchester United are still in need of completing a number of deals before the deadline

Manchester United slumped to a 2-1 defeat to Brighton on Saturday after a late Joao Pedro winner. The result adds pressure on manager Erik ten Hag after a turbulent summer, and just one week left of the transfer window.
United are still hoping to move on Jadon Sancho, but differences in valuation are making a deal difficult to come by.
Scott McTominay could also leave with the latest reports suggesting Napoli are interested in securing the services of the midfielder.
A deal for Manuel Ugarte remains in the pipeline and an official move is expected to be completed next week.
As was the case against Fulham, Sancho was omitted from Ten Hag’s squad for United’s trip to Brighton, though the winger was still forced to travel to the South Coast with the team.
The English international’s future at United remains in jeopardy despite a reconciliation between himself and Ten Hag after last season’s falling out.
A move to Juventus looks most likely, but neither club can reach an agreement over the player’s valuation, with United wanting £40million for a permanent sale.
Even so, the United boss said he still has a decision to make over Sancho’s future.
The wait for a deal for Ugarte remains ongoing, much to the chagrin of supporters.

The PSG midfielder was once again omitted from Luis Enrique’s squad on Friday night, with the understanding that a loan move to Old Trafford is imminent despite United hoping to secure a permanent deal.
L’Equipe report Ugarte is waiting for his agent, Jorge Mendes, to give the green light to travel to England. The report states that while a move is “doubtless”, details are still being “ironed out”.
It was reported earlier this week that a completed deal for Ugarte relied on outgoings from United, though a broad agreement was "close".
Jamie Carragher has sensationally backed Cole Palmer to complete a move to Manchester United within a year.
The England winger enjoyed a brilliant year since leaving boyhood club Manchester City for Chelsea. The 22-year-old scored 25 goals in all competitions across a stunning debut campaign.

Speaking on The Overlap with Sky Bet, Carragher said: “Something’s just come to me here. If Chelsea have another poor season, we were talking earlier about Manchester United having a real problem on that right wing.

“He [Palmer] is a big Man United fan isn’t he? Would that not be something that United should visit maybe in 12 months if it doesn’t go well? You know what, I think that could happen. Yeah, Cole Palmer to Man United.”
As it stands, a move to Old Trafford looks highly unlikely. Palmer has only just put pen to paper on a new nine-year deal with Chelsea that runs until 2033 and features a significant hike in wages.

headline: Andre Onana's remarkable three-word Man Utd ambition after latest defeat
body: Andre Onana has chosen to remain upbeat despite Manchester United being handed their first defeat of the season after goals from Danny Welbeck Joao Pedro rounded off a tough day at the Amex

Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana has claimed the club's ambition is "to win everything" despite their 2-1 loss to Brighton on Saturday - with the Cameroonian "still positive" the team can have a successful season under Erik ten Hag.
The Red Devils were handed their first defeat of the season at the Amex as goals from Danny Welbeck and Joao Pedro condemned them to defeat - after Amad Diallo had equalised in the second half.

There was optimism for United this season after making a string of big name signings to kickstart a new era under chiefs Omar Berrada and Dan Ashworth, who have brought in Leny Yoro, Joshua Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt, and an opening win over Fulham at home looked like a great start.
United are now under the microscope again after a tough campaign last year - though Onana chose to remain upbeat when asked about the club's ambitions this season.

When quizzed about what United were targeting this term, he said: "To win everything. We know what this shirt means so we have to go for every trophy we face, it's one of the biggest clubs in the world."

Speaking further about the game, Onana said the United players were struggling to understand how they lost the game, adding: "It's difficult for is to accept because we have a good game, we had more chances than them. It's difficult but we are still positive. We have big players, we are a big club and it's the second game of the season. A lot of big ambitions this season so we stay very positive."
"We came here to win and unfortunately we didn't win. I don't want to talk about mistakes because we win together and we lose together. We have a big game coming next week and we have to win."

"[We can] only can be positive because through the tough times, we have to be together. We will look at the videos and be together. We are here to win and we have to look at what we did wrong so I have no doubt about that."

It only gets tougher for United as they prepare to welcome Arne Slot's Liverpool to Old Trafford in their next game before the international break, with Ten Hag aware his side have work to do after a sloppy defensive display.
The Dutchman admitted both goals United conceded were "soft" and "avoidable" as he lamented United's failure to make their dominance count.

"It’s very disappointing, especially when over long parts of the game you have control," Ten Hag said after the game. "We are controlling the game so well in possession and we were doing so well and we concede two unnecessary goals to concede, very avoidable. We concede two soft goals when we should act better as a team."

"We have to take the positives. We have to learn, and you can’t drop points. It’s so unnecessary if you protect the goal like we do, but then we drop points. And top football is about details, so we have to do better in those situations."

headline: Erik ten Hag leaves Man Utd fans in no doubt over decision to take off Mason Mount
body: Erik ten Hag has explained the reason why he swapped Mason Mount for Joshua Zirkzee at half-time of Manchester United's 2-1 defeat by Brighton on Saturday afternoon
Mason Mount was substituted at half-time during Manchester United’s defeat by Brighton after reporting an injury.

United were beaten 2-1 on the south coast as Joao Pedro’s 95th-minute header made the difference for Brighton. And the disappointing result was made even worse by an injury concern for Mount, who was brought off during the break for Joshua Zirkzee.

Mount managed just 20 appearances in all competitions last season following a £55million transfer from Chelsea due to injuries. The 25-year-old managed to begin their campaign fully fit thanks to pre-season, but Erik ten Hag gave some bad news in his post-match press conference.
"It was forced," Ten Hag said when asked why Mount was withdrawn. "He had an issue, he mentioned an issue and I didn't want to take a risk. I don't know how much of a worry it is in this moment.

"But we have a good bench. If you can bring Zirkzee and don't hesitate, bring him off and you bring a player who has an impact and we see Josh had a great game." It remains to be seen how serious Mount’s knock is, but he is a doubt for United’s next match against Liverpool at Old Trafford next Sunday.

Brighton were 1-0 up at half-time thanks to Danny Welbeck’s tap-in from Kaoru Mitoma’s cross which may have forced Ten Hag’s hand with changes anyway. Zirkzee, who scored the winner in the season-opener vs Fulham last weekend, was summoned and United levelled in the second half.

Amad raced in behind and equalised via a deflection before United appeared to have gone 2-1 up through substitute Alejandro Garnacho. However, replays showed that Garnacho’s effort hit an offside Zirkzee before it crossed the line, forcing VAR to rule the goal out.

Pedro was then left unmarked to nod in the winner in injury time and heap pressure onto Ten Hag already. "I thought a draw would’ve been half acceptable but to lose the game, it puts an awful lot of pressure, I think, on Erik ten Hag and on towards the game next week against Liverpool,” Gary Neville told NBC Sports.

"I think the first half of the game, I don’t think any of us were surprised. It’s very difficult to play football without a centre-forward. The lads in the studio will tell you, you need a focal point up front. He corrected that at half-time by bringing Zirkzee on, but you’ve already wasted 45 minutes in the match and that’s a real problem.”

headline: opinionMarcus Rashford should heed Raheem Sterling warning as Man Utd blow Brighton chance
body: Poor defending and a blunted end-product saw Manchester United suffer a 2-1 defeat to Brighton & Hove Albion on Saturday courtesy of Joao Pedro's last-gasp header
Raheem Sterling should serve as a warning to Marcus Rashford - top players won't be picked upon reputation forever.
And on an afternoon that felt all too like last season for Manchester United - his performance at the Amex quickly began to descend into all too familiar territory.
The 26-year-old England international has become an easy scapegoat at Old Trafford since inking a bumper five-year contract worth £325,000-a-week last summer.

And it's important to clarify and contextualise that Rashford was not the only United player off the pace as Bruno Fernandes was dispossessed cheaply by Billy Gilmour for Danny Welbeck's opener - which could also have been prevented by Harry Maguire.
But given this is just the second match of the new Premier League season - on the back of Rashford's Euro 2024 axe - Erik ten Hag would be right to command so much more from his star forward.
Rashford saw an equaliser, a cutely flicked rebound, chalked off for offside during the first-half and his head quickly began to drop during this dramatic, yet forgettable, defeat.
He made several penetrative runs in behind Brighton's backline, which camped high and struggled to turn on the stodgy, rain-soaked turf, but his team-mates failed to execute the final ball.
And Rashford quickly became agitated, then infuriated, then simply began to sulk until the half-time interval.
He was correct to feel aggrieved because the pass he required was not complex and it was not a one-off occurrence.
However, Rashford also had to take some level of accountability for his eagerness as on more than one occasion, he simply went too hastily.

From that point onwards, his contribution began to nosedive and on 65 minutes Rashford was already walking to the side of the field in anticipation that he would be subbed as Alejandro Garnacho prepared to enter the fray.

Goalscorer Amad, spurred on by the tragic passing of his mother, upstaged Rashford once again with his direct dribbling and desire to attack his full-back, while Garnacho was unfortunate not to start.
His impact was explosive and almost instant following his introduction.
He looked to have fired United ahead but Joshua Zirkzee's questionable poaching instincts saw the goal correctly chalked off for offside by VAR.
And as Rashford trudged his way around the back of Jason Steele's goal, past the travelling supporters and back to United's bench, you began to wonder how it has come to this.

It took him what appeared to be an age to acknowledge the United fans, who were applauding in their numbers, and while he did eventually clap back, his head was down and his body language conveyed that he is not enjoying his football.
Rashford's Euro 2024 setback should have ignited the fire within his belly but there has seemingly been no change on the mediocrity he served up last season.

United's board of directors were here in their numbers and they will want to see more from one of the club's top-earners, who must respond to keep his place in Ten Hag's side with Amad in the ascendancy and Joshua Zirkzee looking to nail down a starting berth.

Ten Hag has bigger fish to dry as he looks to pick the bones out of this late defeat but the most disappointing aspect about Rashford's demise is that he no longer has the confidence to beat his marker.
His movements have become all too predictable and he would rather pause, turn and play a backwards pass as opposed to attempting a daring dribble.
Brighton's £30m signing Yankuba Minteh is far from the finished article, he was utterly chaotic to watch at times, but he was always on the front-foot.
Rashford has the end-product Minteh is lacking but currently seems incapable of putting it into action.
Where is the Rashford that struck 30 goals in all competitions in 2022-23? Or the Rashford that top-scored for England at the World Cup? That player cannot go to waste.

headline: Gary Neville picks out Man Utd player to blame after Brighton's late winner
body: Erik ten Hag's men were beaten 2-1 away at the Seagulls as they were handed their first loss of the season and Gary Neville believes Casemiro was at fault for Joao Pedro's late winning goal at the Amex

Gary Neville has hit out at Casemiro for contributing to Brighton's late winning goal against Manchester United and believes he showed a "lack of concentration" by leaving his position at the back post.

Erik ten Hag's men were beaten 2-1 away at the Seagulls as they were handed their first loss of the season, with Danny Welbeck netting a first half opener before Amad equalised midway through the second half.

With time ticking away, Joao Pedro scored a late header in stoppage time to deliver more misery to the Red Devils after a turbulent campaign last season - with the team's defensive capabilities called into question once again.

Neville says the result puts an "awful lot of pressure" on Ten Hag already this season - especially with Liverpool to come next. And pinpointed Casemiro as a culprit for Brighton's winner after the Brazilian deserted his position at the back post before drifting into midfield. Pedro was then left unmarked to nod in the dramatic winning goal.

"Really depressing end to the game," he told NBC Sports. I thought a draw would’ve been half acceptable but to lose the game, it puts an awful lot of pressure, I think, on Erik ten Hag and on towards the game next week against Liverpool."
Neville said United looked like they were struggling in the first half without a clear centre forward, with Joshua Zirkzee only brought on for the second half - saying they "wasted 45 minutes".

He added: "Then in the second half, the first goal as well was poor defensively, that last goal, I’ve just watched it then coming up to the gantry. When you clear from a corner, you’ve got to still defend as you’re defending the second phase of a corner.

"I think particularly if you watch Casemiro, it looks to me, I’ve only watched it once back on the replay, it looks like he leaves his position at that back post and runs back towards central midfield.
"But then it leaves an acre of space in that back zone where there are three Brighton players queuing up. Lack of concentration, lack of focus and it does put some pressure on them."
Ten Hag was critical of his players after the game, admitting he expected better of his side and calling both of Brighton's goals "soft".

'There was more than one mistake. We have to talk about it. We were close to winning this game, but definitely shouldn't lose the game. Today we should so better. In the Community Shield we should do better.

'Both goals are very soft goals. We should have done better. I have seem some good parts in the game and other parts ... early in the second half we should have more control of the game. In both boxes we should be more clinical and aggressive.'

headline: Erik ten Hag points finger of blame for Man Utd's late collapse in Brighton loss
body: Manchester United suffered a late 2-1 defeat to Brighton & Hove Albion on Saturday to mark their first league defeat of the new Premier League season
Erik ten Hag bemoaned his team’s "unnecessary" poor defending and lack of clinical edge against Brighton - calling on his side to “act better as a team”.
Manchester United  fell victim to Joao Pedro’s injury-time header which secured a 2-1 victory for Fabian Hurzeler’s side who continued their perfect start to the league campaign.
Ex-Red Devil  Danny Welbeck  opened the scoring from close range midway through the first half of Saturday's clash, but the visitors restored parity on the hour-mark through Amad’s deflected strike.

United thought they’d clinched the winner through substitute Alejandro Garnacho, but the 20-year-old’s goal was chalked off by VAR for offside due to a stray knee from fellow substitute Joshua Zirkzee who had slid onto the goal-line.
The misfortune was ultimately punished when Pedro nodded home Simon Adingra's cross unopposed. And Ten Hag criticised the slipshod defending that enabled both goals.

"It’s very disappointing, especially when over long parts of the game you have control," Ten Hag said after the game. "We are controlling the game so well in possession and we were doing so well and we concede two unnecessary goals to concede, very avoidable.
He added: "We concede two soft goals when we should act better as a team."

Asked what we wanted to see better from his side in those moments, Ten Hag said: "So many things in that moment. We have to talk, we have to be alive in certain moments, what to do and everyone knows their job as a team in how we protect our goal."

Ten Hag hailed his side for showing "resilience" to recover from going a goal down against the Seagulls, but he expressed discontent with the number of chances spurned in the first-half that saw his team trailing at the interval.

"I don’t think before half-time, we created our chances," he said. "We had good chances, so the best chance before half-time was from Amad, the cross off Diogo [Dalot], then Mason Mount had a very good chance.
"So before half-time we had three or four good opportunities and from there, two very good chances and we should be winning at half-time."

He added: "I think there were very good parts in the game. We had a lot of control in possession, created good chances, showed resilience and we came back and then we scored a winning goal or we thought it was the winning goal but the ball was on the line. On the line, just before the line. It’s disappointing but I can take the positives.

"We have to take the positives. We have to learn, and you can’t drop points. It’s so unnecessary if you protect the goal like we do, but then we drop points. And top football is about details, so we have to do better in those situations."

headline: Man Utd pay Brighton penalty after costly goal-line mishap - 6 talking points
body: BRIGHTON 2-1 MAN UTD: Danny Welbeck's 100th club career goal and a late strike from Joao Pedro secured a memorable and deserved victory for the Seagulls against Erik ten Hag's side
Manchester United were hit with a late Brighton sucker punch as the Seagulls secured a dramatic, stoppage time victory.

Joao Pedro was the hero for the South Coast club as he nodded home late on to continue the hosts' perfect start to the campaign. Ex-Red Devil Danny Welbeck had opened the scoring from close range midway through the first half of Saturday's clash. The Seagulls continued to threaten through the striker, while veteran midfielder James Milner also had a number of chances.
Despite that, Erik ten Hag's men found themselves level on the hour mark through Amad's deflected effort. Alejandro Garnacho then netted but saw his strike ruled out by VAR.

The Red Devils' anguish was then even worse as Pedro took advantage of awful defending to score the winner. Check out all of the talking points from the Amex Stadium on a gutting afternoon for the Red Devils:

It was certainly a surprise to see summer signing Joshua Zirkzee benched on the South coast. After all, the former Bologna man had secured the Red Devils three points against Fulham with a memorable debut goal.

But supporters should not be surprised. Following the Dutchman's arrival, Erik ten Hag suggested that he would need to time to adapt to the demands of Premier League football. And his place on the bench against Brighton appears to be part of that process.
It did not take long for Ten Hag to turn to Zirkzee as he replaced Mason Mount at half-time. He worked hard but was ultimately the villain for the Red Devils but more about that later on...

From a current Red Devils striker to a former one, Danny Welbeck was left toasting his 100th career goal against his former side. Some horrendous defending saw two crosses failed to be cut out before reaching Kaoru Mitoma.

The Japanese international picked out Welbeck, who slid in to poke home. And despite his strike coming against his former side, the former Red Devils academy graduate allowed himself a celebration considering his milestone.

It's also now two goals in as many games for the forward at the start of the campaign - form he will be very keen to continue throughout the remainder of the season. It's also the sixth time he has found the net against Man United.

Even after Welbeck's opener, Brighton had a number of opportunities to add to their lead. An excellent team move saw the Seagulls tear through their visitors, with ex-Liverpool star Milner given the simple opportunity to roll home.
But he did not get enough purchase on his effort and Diogo Dalot got back just in time to clear the ball off of the line. Milner also fired a presentable effort from range over.
Welbeck might have doubled his afternoon's work after another brilliant Brighton move but nodded right into the arms of Onana, while he then rattled the bar with another effort.

Brighton's missed chances eventually came back to bite them as the Red Devils found an equaliser through Amad. The Ivorian winger raced down the right flank, cut inside Jack Hinselwood and let fly with a powerful effort.

Both Lewis Dunk and Jan Paul van Hecke slid in to try and clear but the latter only served the thunder the ball into his own net. It was just the tonic the Red Devils needed as they threatened to lose control of the game.
Man United thought they had claimed the lead after polishing off a stunning move. Amad released Bruno Fernandes down the right, who crossed towards substitute Alejandro Garnacho.
The Argentinian forward tapped home and wheeled off in celebration. Unfortunately, a stray knee from Zirkzee saw the goal chalked off.

The ball had hit the Dutchman - who was offside and practically on the goalline. The officials did not see the touch initially but VAR intervened and correctly ruled the strike out to the frustration of Garnacho, Zirkzee and more.
In honesty, the Red Devils did not deserve to win. And Brighton were probably the better side. They proved it late on too.

Brazilian forward Joao Pedro was given acres of room in stoppage time and nodded home Simon Adingra's cross unopposed. It just added to Man United's woes and leaves Ten Hag with a lot of thinking to do as he attempts to find an answer to how the have lost the game.

headline: Bruno Fernandes' ear-blasting from Man Utd team-mate shows squad's clear frustrations
body: Hard-hitting defensive midfielder Casemiro couldn't contain his frustration with Manchester United skipper Bruno Fernandes during Saturday's disastrous loss at Brighton
Frustration was obvious among Manchester United's players on Saturday – highlighted by experienced Casemiro's outburst at captain Bruno Fernandes.

During Saturday's 2-1 loss at Brighton and Hove Albion, the experienced defensive midfielder vented towards club captain Bruno Fernandes in the first-half, after failing to capitalise on a dangerous free kick. United won a free-kick midway into Brighton's half, with the 29-year-old Portuguese star stepping up to deliver a ball into the box.

While an unmarked Casemiro connected with the ball, the Brazilian sent it soaring over the bar – much to his own disgust. But instead of turning his attention to his own effort, the 32-year-old decided to give Fernandes a piece of his mind on his delivery.

Casemiro had to check his run during the free-kick, with the ball looking to land in the penalty area behind him - turning to his captain to berate his efforts. And while he could have easily put the Red Devils 1-0 up with a better header during the instance, Casemiro instead saw fingers pointed his way for Brighton taking the lead in the 32nd minute.

The midfielder jogged back into the box as an unmarked Danny Wellbeck found the back of the net against his former club. Kaoru Mitoma picked the ball up deep into enemy territory, finding the Seagulls striker unmarked in the middle of the box for a tap in - the 100th goal of his Premier League career thus far.

And social media users were quick to point out Casemiro's error at the other end of the pitch. One wrote: "Maguire marked a man, same as Martinez, Casemiro left Welbeck unmarked, that’s the reason for the goal," while another complained: "Casemiro jogging back kills me."

Manchester United's late win on the opening game of the season last week, edging past Fulham 1-0 at Old Trafford, was quickly forgotten thanks to Joao Pedro's injury-time winner at the Amex, which will only further highlight the frustrations in the United camp.

Erik ten Hag's players clearly have work to be done should they hope to chase at least a top-four finish, especially considering their dismal eighth-place finish in the 2023/24 campaign. Up next for United is arch-rivals Liverpool at Old Trafford next Sunday.

headline: Jamie Carragher makes remarkable Cole Palmer prediction amid Chelsea issues
body: Cole Palmer has proven an inspired signing for Chelsea following their swoop for the former Manchester City man but Jamie Carragher believes he could return to the north west sooner rather than later
Jamie Carragher has backed Cole Palmer to complete a sensational move to Manchester United within a year.
The England winger has enjoyed a brilliant year since leaving boyhood club Manchester City for Chelsea. The 22-year-old scored 25 goals in all competitions across a stunning debut campaign.
That saw Palmer win the Premier League Young Player of the Season, PFA Fans' Player of the Year and PFA Young Player of the Year awards. Despite that, it was still a difficult season for Chelsea.

The Blues finished sixth under Mauricio Pochettino, who was eventually replaced by former Leicester boss Enzo Maresca. And Carragher believes Palmer could be on his way to Old Trafford should Chelsea struggle again this term.

Speaking on The Overlap with Sky Bet, Carragher said: “Something’s just come to me here. If Chelsea have another poor season, we were talking earlier about Manchester United having a real problem on that right wing.

“He [Palmer] is a big Man United fan isn’t he? Would that not be something that United should visit maybe in 12 months if it doesn’t go well? You know what, I think that could happen. Yeah, Cole Palmer to Man United.”
As it stands, a move to Old Trafford looks highly unlikely. Palmer has only just put pen to paper on a new nine-year deal with Chelsea that runs until 2033.
That new deal has seen the winger’s wages at Stamford Bridge rise considerably. Speaking after committing his future to the Blues, he said: “I’m delighted to sign this new deal.

“I achieved a lot in my first season here and hopefully I can continue to experience great things at this club, both on a personal level and in terms of bringing success and trophies to Chelsea.”

United have already invested heavily this summer ahead for Erik ten Hag’s third season at the helm. Defence has been their first aspect of concern having signed Leny Yoro from Lille before completing a double deal for Bayern Munich pair Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui.

United have also welcomed a new forward to the club this summer after signing Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna. The Dutch forward marked his debut with the winning goal against Fulham. Palmer is still awaiting his first goal of the campaign.

headline: Ruud van Nistelrooy told of scenario where he could become Man Utd boss
body: Ruud van Nistelrooy was one of the big arrivals into Manchester United this summer, but one other former Red Devil believes the coach could one day become manager at Old Trafford
Michael Owen believes Ruud van Nistelrooy could be in line to become the manager of Manchester United.

Van Nistelrooy, 48, returned to Old Trafford as Erik ten Hag's assistant manager, just over a year after he resigned as manager of PSV Eindhoven due to a "lack of support". His time back on the red side of Manchester started well with a home victory over Fulham.

The ex-Real Madrid striker's return to the club also comes soon after Ten Hag was widely believed to be destined for the sack. While the jury remains out on Ten Hag amongst the fanbase, Van Nistelrooy has been getting to work with a United side bolstered by the arrivals of fellow countrymen Joshua Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt, as well as 18-year-old central defender Leny Yoro and ex-Ajax star Noussair Mazraoui.
Owen believes the Red Devils legend could one day find himself in the dugout in the same way Ole Gunnar Solskjaer did.

While speaking to OLBG, Owen said: “It’s an interesting situation for Ruud van Nistelrooy at Manchester United, because if it’s five games, 50 games or 500 games, Erik ten Hag will go at some point. When it does happen the club will look for a new manager and because that takes time, there is often an interim coach or a caretaker while that search happens.

“So if Van Nistelrooy doesn’t leave before Ten Hag, you would think that he would get a handful of games as manager like Ryan Giggs and Michael Carrick have done in the past. Even Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was temporary and he did well enough to buy himself more time and eventually they had to give him the job.

“It doesn't take a genius to work out that having been a manager and now being the assistant manager at his former club, Van Nistelrooy could get to manage Manchester United at some point. But I think at this stage he's obviously coming to the club to help Ten Hag change their fortunes around.
"I don't think he's got eyes on that prize just yet. But in the future I definitely wouldn't be surprised if he got to manage the team for a handful of games.”

Owen is not the only person who think Van Nistelrooy could be managing the club in the near future. Rene Meulensteen, who was Sir Alex Ferguson's assistant manager for many years, also thinks Sir Jim Ratcliffe would consider Van Nistelrooy, if Ten Hag was to leave.
The ex-Fulham boss told Gambling Zone: “I don’t think Erik ten Hag will be worried about Ruud van Nistelrooy potentially replacing him, he’s too focused on the job at hand.
“But who knows what the future will bring. If United stutter at the start of the season and the results don’t go their way, Sir Jim Ratcliffe would consider Van Nistelrooy.

"But at the moment they believe that Erik is the right man and now we need to see what happens. It is an interesting development, what has happened at Manchester United because Ten Hag brought in his trusted staff and many of them have gone.
"Now he has brought in his friend Rene Hake, who was manager of Utrecht, as well as Van Nistelrooy, so he has identified what he needs.”

headline: Erik ten Hag responds to Jadon Sancho snub after making Man Utd star travel to Brighton
body: The future of England international Jadon Sancho at Manchester United looks increasingly uncertain after a falling out between himself and manager Erik ten Hag last season
Erik ten Hag said he still has a choice to make over the future of Jadon Sancho.

The future of the England international at Old Trafford remains in question despite reconciling with Ten Hag earlier this summer. Sancho was initially banished last season from first-team training following a disagreement with the Dutchman last September. The winger was then sent out on loan to his former club Borussia Dortmund for the second-half of last season, where he helped the German side reach the Champions League final.
While Sancho and Ten Hag are said to have made peace after last season's discord, the 24-year-old looked destined for a move away this summer with United working hard to move the Englishman on.

Juventus, Borussia Dortmund and an unnamed Premier League club are said to be keen on a move. Sancho was omitted from United's squad altogether for their first Premier League match of the new season against Fulham last weekend.

Yet, for United's Saturday lunchtime kick-off against Brighton, Ten Hag confirmed that Sancho had again been left out of his squad - despite being made to travel south - and added that a verdict over his future remains his to make.
Ten Hag's side were ravaged by injuries last season with much effect on the manager, who has insisted in the run-up to the new season that "survival of the fittest" is his campaign mantra.

Sancho looked to be the first and most high-profile casualty of this new philosophy when he was left out of the squad to face Fulham, albeit Ten Hag later said he had an ear infection and could not play.

United have been busy in the transfer window this summer thus far, but the club remain firm in their pursuit of Paris Saint-Germain's Manuel Ugarte. Talks over a swap deal with PSG concerning Ugarte and Sancho collapsed earlier this summer.

Thus the permanent sale of Sancho could help raise the necessary funds for United to get a deal over the line. While Juventus look to be in pole position, the Italians are struggling to meet United's £40million valuation - while matching his salary at Old Trafford would also be an issue.
Asked about the potential for new signings before the end of the window, Ten Hag said: "We will see, we always have to look to get better but that has to be the right options."

headline: Vincent Kompany rubbishes Man Utd's Matthijs de Ligt transfer claims: 'It makes no sense'
body: Matthijs de Ligt was reunited with Erik ten Hag this summer after completing a move from Bayern Munich to Manchester United and Vincent Kompany has now been forced to speak out on the decision to sell
Vincent Kompany has slammed “stupid” claims that he had named Matthijs de Ligt as his “No.1 defender” before then selling him to Manchester United.

The Dutchman completed an initial €45m (£38.4m) move to Old Trafford earlier this summer. He was followed by ex-Bayern Munich and Ajax teammate Noussair Mazraoui who also signed a permanent deal with the Red Devils.

De Ligt’s move brought to an end a long pursuit of his signature, with Erik ten Hag leading the push for his services. While he was delighted to get a deal over the line, his former boss Vincent Kompany reportedly had different feelings.

It was suggested that the new Bayern boss had previously told De Ligt that he was his “No.1 defender” and that it was instead the German giants’ hierarchy attempting to sell him. But a spokesperson for Bayern has since said that Kompany never 'said words to that effect'.

And the former Man City star has now hit back at suggestions that De Ligt was sold against his will. He said: “It would've been so stupid of me to say something like that. It wouldn't fit with what we've planned for the entire squad. It makes no sense”.

Bayern chief Max Eberl has also offered his view on the decision to sell De Ligt. He said: "We have to make decisions where we feel we can have the greatest possible success. We made decisions together with Vincent Kompany. Matthijs de Ligt has delivered very consistent performances.

“We wanted an additional left-footer, which is why we brought in Hiroki Ito. That's squad planning, then we spend money, then you as a club have to earn money too. We spoke to the players very transparently and then made decisions and that's how we got the squad we have now."

De Ligt, 25, made 73 appearances over two seasons for Bayern after arriving for big money from Italian giants Juventus. But he made just 16 starts in the Bundesliga last term as Bayern lost their title to Bayer Leverkusen.
He has been made to wait for his full United debut since making his move to Old Trafford. De Ligt has started on the bench for the Red Devils’ opening two games against Fulham and Brighton.

Speaking after completing his move, the defender said: “As soon as I heard that Manchester United wanted me, I felt an excitement about the opportunity for a new challenge at such an historic club. In the conversations that followed, I was impressed by the vision that the football leadership set out, and the role they saw for me in it.

“Erik ten Hag shaped the early stages of my career, so he knows how to get the best out of me and I cannot wait to work with him again. I know what it takes to succeed at the highest level, and I’m determined to continue that record at this special club.”

headline: Forgotten Man Utd ace surprisingly dubbed 'toughest ever opponent' who was 'superior'
body: Former England defender Joleon Lescott has named the one Manchester United player who stood out as his toughest ever opponent - and it's not one you'd expect like Wayne Rooney or Cristiano Ronaldo
Joleon Lescott has thrown a curveball by naming Louis Saha as his toughest ever on-field adversary.
The former England defender progressed through the ranks at Wolverhampton Wanderers. And it was during these formative years that he tussled with Saha, then a hotshot for Fulham.

Saha later sparkled at Manchester United, netting 42 times in 124 outings under Sir Alex Ferguson's stewardship and clinching two Premier League crowns alongside a sought-after Champions League triumph in 2008. Despite that, he was often overshadowed in that golden era by United's glittering offensive line-up consisting of stars like Wayne Rooney, Ruud van Nistelrooy, Carlos Tevez and Cristiano Ronaldo.

However, speaking on the Football's Greatest podcast with pundit Jeff Stelling, Lescott was asked: "I don't think anybody will pick this guy but of course a footballer's perspective is very different to a football fan's perspective isn't it? So tell me, who is the No. 1 striker you've played against Joleon?"

Lescott responded with a surprising admission: "Louis Saha – King Louis. I was at Wolves and these are players that have given me the toughest time. At Wolves, he's at Fulham Fulham are top of the league, averaged 2.5 goals a game. Top of the league first 10 games of the season so I'm aware this is going to be a tough game."

The defender also opened up about a humbling experience he had on the pitch, saying: "I go into the game thinking it's going to be tough... 0-0, I get man of the match thinking, 'It's not as tough as I thought'. Fast forward four weeks, I played him in the cup, I'm thinking, 'It's going to be the same'. He's obviously thinking, 'I need to up my level', and that was the first time I came across someone that in every attribute I valued, he was better than.

"If someone was faster, I was stronger, could tactically be better, physically could be better or whatever. Whatever they had, I could use a different attribute to navigate a better outcome not that I'm saying I dominated every opponent, but that was someone, the first person I came across that in every element of the game I considered important, he showed me that he was superior."

Lescott continued (via the Manchester Evening News): "He made me realise, 'Oh there's another level to go here, I can't just play on the things I think are important'. He scored, we lost 3-0. He scored a free kick with his right foot and a pen with his left foot and the ball come to him and he chipped it with the outside of his foot, ran one side the ball went the other side.

"I was just disorientated and he was just something that I'd never experienced, and the first time I experienced it and for that I always had so much respect for Louis. And then I got to play with him at Everton and I still call him King Louis now when I speak to him."

Saha and Lescott teamed up at Everton in 2008, securing a notable fifth-place finish in the Premier League – Everton's second-best Premier League result after their fourth-place finish in the 2004/05 season. Lescott continued his career with Manchester City, West Bromwich Albion, Aston Villa and AEK Athens before retiring at Sunderland in 2017, while Saha followed a similar trajectory.
After his time at Fulham, Saha joined United in 2004. He then had a four-year spell with Everton before transferring to Spurs, Sunderland and Lazio, finally hanging up his boots in 2013.

headline: Manchester United told transfer target 'will leave' after failed Liverpool offer
body: Manchester United have been linked with a move for Brazilian midfielder Andre and Fluminense president Mario Bittencourt has admitted the club are willing to sell
Manchester United have been put on red alert after Fluminense president Mario Bittencourt revealed he has promised to help midfielder Andre "fulfil his dream of playing in Europe".

Reports from Brazil have linked Andre with both United and Wolves and Mirror Football understands that Wolves do hold an interest in the player, but are not actively pursuing a deal right now - putting United in pole position should a deal for Manuel Ugarte fall through.

Andre was targeted by Liverpool last year, but Fluminense rejected their approach because they viewed the midfielder as a key part of their bid to win the Copa Libertadores. Andre ultimately stayed and Fluminense went on to lift the trophy, beating Boca Juniors 2-1 in the final.

When asked about Andre's future, Bittencourt detailed Liverpool's attempts to sign the 23-year-old and admitted Fluminense are now willing to cash in on him if an appropriate offer comes in from Europe.

"Liverpool actually made an official offer last year during the Libertadores round of 16," Bittencourt revealed in an interview with Flashscore. "Liverpool's directors contacted me directly, but I told them the player wasn't for sale at that time.
"We wanted to keep him for the Libertadores because we truly believed we could win it last year. We were fully prepared for that competition. Liverpool understood our position on the matter.

"He's the player we've expected for over a year to attract offers. If no offer comes, we'll keep the player and certainly increase his value even more. Offers might come in December, January or mid-next year. To be honest, the player and his agent have were very fair to us last year.

"It's the player who decides, the player leaves when he wants. It's not good to have a discontented player. Last year he said if we didn't want to sell, he'd stay to win the Libertadores. Now I've given my word to help him fulfil his dream of playing in Europe."

Fluminense are said to value Andre at around £25million and Fulham had also been linked with a move for the midfielder, before completing the signing of Sander Berge from Burnley to replace Joao Palhinha.

headline: Manchester United ace sent warning by Chelsea and Tottenham players over £30m transfer
body: Manchester United are still looking to sort out a significant sale before the transfer window closes, but there's reason to suspect the certain player should be wary of joining Antonio Conte's Napoli
Scott McTominay might be wise to be cautious over a potential move to Antonio Conte's Napoli if he leaves Manchester United.

The Serie A heavyweights are rumoured to be keen on securing a deal for the Red Devils midfielder, who has once again been linked with a departure from Old Trafford following interest from Fulham. However, the Manchester Evening News have reported how life under Conte may not be plain sailing for the Scotland international.

That's after Conte, 55, saw his time in England tainted by claims of discord within his Chelsea and Tottenham squads. The Italian managed Spurs until March 2023 but left under a cloud after openly criticising his team following a 3-3 draw with Southampton.

Just before his exit, The Guardian reported some at Tottenham were itching for Conte to leave. It was alleged that several players wanted him out after what they considered to be poor treatment of the dressing room.

And it wasn't just in north London where he faced opposition from his players after there were reports of discontent within the squad at Stamford Bridge too. After clinching the Premier League title with Chelsea in 2017, The Sun reported certain Blues stars were worn out by the coach's training regimes, which are known to be strenuous.

"Around us, there is a lot of b******t," Conte candidly told the press at the time, dismissing such speculation. "I see in the past it happened the same with a lot of managers. A lot of b******t. They try to create problems between me, the club and players."

McTominay looks set to face a crucial decision about his future at United with less than a week left in the transfer window. The £30million-rated midfielder reportedly wants to stay at the club he's been with since his childhood, but sources indicate United may be looking to cash in to bolster their transfer kitty.

The Times reported Napoli have shown interest in a loan move for McTominay, which could be complicated by the fact the player has only one year remaining on his current United contract – though there is an option to extend that by a year, which would then allow for a loan with option or obligation to buy deal. Meanwhile, rumours are swirling that McTominay may be included in a deal to secure PSG's Manuel Ugarte.

If McTominay were to make the leap to Italy, it would mark a significant change of scenery in a drastic shift for his career. However, the experiences of his Premier League rivals may suggest the prospect of being part of Conte's set-up at Napoli comes with its own challenges.

headline: Man Utd insert two clever transfer clauses as Erik ten Hag approves exit
body: Manchester United have included a sell-on clause and a buyback agreement in the deal that has seen defender Will Fish complete a permanent move to Championship side Cardiff City
Manchester United have sold defender Will Fish to Cardiff City, with the Red Devils inserting two transfer clauses into the deal.

Fish has completed a permanent move to the Championship side, having come through United's academy. The 21-year-old impressed during two years on loan in the Scottish Premiership with Hibernian and Cardiff have forked out an initial £1million for the centre-back.

That could reportedly rise to £3m, while United have included a buyback clause and a 30 percent sell-on clause in the deal. Fish is Cardiff's sixth permanent signing so far this summer after the additions of Chris Willock, Calum Chambers, Anwar El Ghazi, Alexander Robertson and Jesper Daland.

"I'm delighted," Fish told club media after completing his move to Cardiff. "It took a while to get it over the line, but now I'm here, I can't wait to get going and embrace it. It's a huge club. The direction that the club want to go in, you've seen a lot of good signings in this window.

"Being a part of that is really exciting and I'm happy to be here. Hopefully, I can do my best for the team. I've spoken to people that have played here in the past and they only said good things. I've heard amazing things about the fans.

"I spoke to David Marshall, who was here and the fans love him. That just shows that if you do well, they'll back you forever. I just can't wait to step out on the pitch. Marshy has played the game for a long time.

"I dropped him a text and the first thing he said was what an amazing football club it is. Marshy, when you speak to him, you know that what he tells you is right, so I have full belief that I'm making the right decision."

Cardiff boss Erol Bulut, meanwhile, is confident Fish is ready to make an impact. "He is a young defender, who has been at Manchester United for many years, so has had a good education from them," Bulut said.

"For the last two years he was in Hibernian, so we watched him and we were interested in him in January too. We hope that he will progress with us in a good way. He is still 21 years old, just starting his career and he is good on the ball, good in duels, so he will add to our playing style.
"Of course, he has to push to be in the team. He is not quite ready to play yet, so he will be with us after the international break and hopefully he can add positive things to our game."

We're now well into the final week of the 2024 summer transfer window and Premier League clubs look set to be busy.

This summer's window slams shut on Friday, August 30 at 11pm. And there could be a few major deals to go through before then. Arsenal are on the verge of making Real Sociedad's Mikel Merino their next signing.

Manchester United are also chasing a new midfielder and are trying to thrash out an agreement with PSG for Manuel Ugarte. Attention then turns to exits at Old Trafford with Jadon Sancho in talks with Juventus.
His England colleague Raheem Sterling could also be on the move. He has fallen out of favour at Chelsea, with Aston Villa and Crystal Palace among the sides chasing his services.
Finally, Liverpool are finally edging towards their first signing of the Arne Slot era with Giorgi Mamardashvili closing in on a move to Anfield.

According to reports in Italy, the Seagulls are closing in on a double deal for Matt O'Riley and Ferdi Kadioglu.
That would take Brighton's summer spending to over £200m this summer.
While Chelsea are interested in a deal for Victor Osimhen, the Blues are now looking for alternatives.

According to The Sun, Chelsea are interested in Everton's Dominic Calvert-Lewin. He is seen as a cheaper alternative to Osimhen, whose lofty wage demands are putting a move to Stamford Bridge on hold.
Juventus' Federico Chiesa has also been identified as a potential recruit.
Arsenal are set too announce the arrival of midfielder Mikel Merino.
The midfielder is set to join the club from Spanish side Real Sociedad. According to reports in Italy, Merino has already completed his medical in North London.
He would become Arsenal's third signing of the summer after David Raya and Riccardo Calafiori.
Despite having only Jamie Vardy to call upon, Leicester are reportedly willing to sell his backup Tom Cannon.

According to The Sun, the Foxes want to cash in on the forward for around £7m with Sheffield United and Stoke both interested. The Blades were interested in taking him on loan but could now slot in a buy clause in any deal.
Cannon only joined Leicester from Everton last summer. He scored three goals across 16 appearances in all competitions in his debut campaign.
Barcelona boss Hansi Flick does not know when he will be able to call upon Dani Olmo's services.

The Catalan giants swoop for the Spanish playmaker this summer but have been unable to register him due to their dire financial situation. Speaking at the weekend, Flick said: "I have hopes but I don’t know. I can’t control it. We have to focus on what we need and today we wanted the three points and we got them."
In case you missed it, Liverpool star Alisson Becker confirmed that he had REJECTED a move to Saudi Arabia.
As quoted by ESPN, the Brazilian international said: "I want to honour my contract and finish my contract here or make a new one. I am really happy here. My family is happy.

"I never got to the point where I was talking about wages and things like this. It was just interest, but when you hear about the numbers the other players are getting you are a little bit attracted. That is normal."

After scoring 28 goals in 114 appearances for Sunderland, Clarke said he was ready for a new chapter and to try his luck in the Premier League.
“I’m really excited to have joined the club and can’t wait to get going,” Clarke said.
“Ipswich have been on a really good trajectory over the last few years and the recruitment this summer has been very impressive, so this was always something I was going to be interested in.

While Gallagher eventually got his move to Atletico, Chelsea called off talks to sign Omorodion and now Porto have shown off a video of the player being applauded by fans at their stadium.
Southampton have agreed a deal to sign Feyenoord's Justin Bijlow, according to Fabrizio Romano.
A verbal agreement is reportedly in place, with a medical the next step in completing the deal.
The news comes as a potential blow to Aaron Ramsdale, who was linked with a move to the Saints as he considers his future.
The England international has been forced to play second fiddle to David Raya at Arsenal.
And with the Spaniard making his loan deal from Brentford permanent this summer, Ramsdale looks unlikely to accrue regular competitive minutes.
Alex McCarthy has started this season as Southampton's first-choice stopper but he could be ousted by Bijlow once he lands on the south coast.
The Sporting CP striker did not shut down rumours that a move away from the club in the final days of the summer transfer window could be on the cards.
Arsenal have shown an interest in the Sweden international throughout the summer window, and now the player himself has addressed the links with the transfer window going into the final few days.
"We don't know what's going to happen,” he told the Portuguese media.

" It doesn't just depend on me, we will see, but I feel good here. I don't feel any stress about doing anything else, but in football, during the transfer window, it's normal there are things we don't know, that can happen quickly. But I love being here and there's no stress."
Chelsea youngster Tino Anjorin looks set to leave Stamford Bridge.
A deal has been verbally agreed with Serie A side Empoli for Anjorin, according to The Athletic.

The highly-rated 22-year-old has spent time out on loan in recent seasons at Lokomotiv Moscow, Huddersfield Town and Portsmouth but will make a permanent move to the Italian side ahead of his medical next week.

Anjorin's exit would mark the latest academy product to depart the club, having progressed through the youth ranks at Stamford Bridge since joining their under-7s and has made five appearances for the senior side.
Ipswich have agreed a deal to sign Dara O'Shea from Burnley, according to The Telegraph.
The Tractor Boys are said to have put in an offer worth around £15million with the 25-year-old set to sign a five-year deal with the newly-promoted side.
The Republic Ireland centre-back, 25, had serious interest from Brentford earlier in the window.
The Brazilian is absent from the squad for Arsenal's Premier League clash with Aston Villa due to a groin problem.
His absence means that Kai Havertz continues in the number nine role. Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Martinelli are either side of him in the Arsenal front line.

Havertz's role as Arsenal's default No 9 has not gone down well in all corners of the Arsenal fanbase, despite his scintillating performance in the Gunners' opening match of the season which saw him score one goal and provide the other in a 2-0 win over Wolves.
You can read the full story below.
Real Sociedad are set to sign Mats Hummels, according to The Athletic.
Hummels, 35, is a free agent after leaving Borussia Dortmund. He would become a replacement for Robin Le Normand, who left La Real for Atletico Madrid earlier this summer.
Mikel Merino will soon be announced as an Arsenal player - and Paul Merson has given his verdict on the midfielder, who will cost £27million plus £4.25m add-ons.

“I don’t think he comes in and plays straight away," ex-Gunner Merson said during Sky Sports' Soccer Saturday. "The price-tag tells you that. I think he plays where Partey plays. He fits Arsenal ’s build, and they’re buying a very, very good footballer.”
Aaron Ramsdale has travelled to Birmingham with Arsenal and is on the bench for their 5.30pm kick-off against Aston Villa.
Ramsdale has been linked with a move to Wolves or Southampton in recent days.
Billy Gilmour starred in Brighton's 2-1 win over Manchester United earlier today, despite being in the midst of a transfer saga involving Napoli.

Fabian Hürzeler on Billy Gilmour playing (exceptionally) despite Napoli talks: "What I can say is that I'm not surprised how he played today. I see the attitude & skill he has. He was completely focused which is not so easy when people talk & say he's leaving the club." #BHAFC
Chelsea have agreed to sell Romelu Lukaku to Napoli.
Lukaku is heading to Naples for £25million (€30m) plus up to £13m (€15m) in add-ons after Napoli changed their transfer approach for Antonio Conte.
Neal Maupay could be set for a return to France, with Nice pushing for his signature, according to reports.
Everton are open to selling the striker but rejected a loan offer from Marseille earlier this summer. He's in the last year of his contract at Everton and is up for returning to his old club.
Brentford are reportedly interested in re-signing Maupay too, with Ivan Toney potentially heading to Saudi Arabia.
Earlier today we brought you news that Southampton were in negotiations with Arsenal over the signing of Aaron Ramsdale.
Well, there might be a cat amongst the pigeons there, with reports in the Netherlands suggesting that Saints are in fact wrapping up a move for Feyenoord goalkeeper Justin Bijlow instead.
Bijlow will be absent from Feyenoord’s squad for their game on Sunday ahead of a move next week.
Manchester United are lining up a move for Fluminense midfielder Andre as a cheaper option in case they can't land Manuel Ugarte from PSG, according to reports in Brazil.

United are still chasing Ugarte but are yet to strike a deal. They have therefore engaged Fluminense over Andre, who would cost a lot less - Fulham had a €25million (£21.2m) bid rejected earlier this summer.
There is some speculation that United could just be trying to put pressure on PSG to lower their €60m (£50.8m) asking price for Ugarte by looking at another player.
Viktor Gyokeres scored a hat-trick for Sporting Lisbon last night - before dropping a hint he could leave.
Gyokeres has been linked with Chelsea and Arsenal - who are both still interested in signing a striker - and remains unsure over where he'll end up.

"We never know what’s going to happen,” Gyokeres told Sport TV. “It doesn’t just depend on me. We’ll see, but I feel good here. I don’t feel any stress about doing anything else. In football, in the transfer window, it’s normal, there are things we don’t know, that happen quickly. But I love being here, there’s no stress."
Erik ten Hag has explained why he has once again left Jadon Sancho out of his squad amid transfer interest in the Manchester United winger from Juventus.
United are playing Brighton in the Premier League's early kick-off, but Sancho isn't involved.
Emiliano Martinez believes Aaron Ramsdale should leave Arsenal for Wolves, with the Aston Villa goalkeeper also aiming a dig at his former club.

"I think he's in a different position to me… he signed for £32m, he was the No. 1 for Arsenal - I never had a chance like that," Martinez said. "When you play every game in the Premier League and then you drop to the bench with the quality that Aaron has… I think he should find a place to play where he feels loved.
"I heard he might go to Wolves, which I think could be a good move for him. He is a player that England needs in their goalkeeping area. He still has a great future."
Manchester United have been put on red alert after Fluminense president Mario Bittencourt revealed he has promised to help midfielder Andre "fulfil his dream of playing in Europe".

Reports from Brazil have linked Andre with both United and Wolves and Mirror Football understands that Wolves do hold an interest in the player, but are not actively pursuing a deal right now - putting United in pole position should a deal for Manuel Ugarte fall through.

"He's the player we've expected for over a year to attract offers. If no offer comes, we'll keep the player and certainly increase his value even more. Offers might come in December, January or mid-next year. To be honest, the player and his agent have were very fair to us last year.

"It's the player who decides, the player leaves when he wants. It's not good to have a discontented player. Last year he said if we didn't want to sell, he'd stay to win the Libertadores. Now I've given my word to help him fulfil his dream of playing in Europe."

Joe Gomez is set to stay at Liverpool despite being left out of the squad which beat Ipswich on the opening day. The defender has been linked with a move in the wake of that game, but Slot has now dismissed the chances of that happening.

"At this moment, I'm expecting everyone to be here. But like you know everything can change. He's worked really hard since he came back, but he didn't play a lot at the Euros. When he came back in the first sessions he couldn't train the whole sessions," he said.

"So we had to manage his load a bit. That was also the reason why he wasn't in the team last Saturday. But this week he had a good week in terms of load and how much he could do with the team. It's been a good week for him and for us until now."
Former Manchester United star Dwigt Yorke has claimed the signing of Eberechi Eze would not make a difference as they should be prioritising a move for a more defensive midfielder instead.

"Even Eberechi Eze won’t push Manchester United to the next level because they don’t get the ball in the right areas," Yorke told CSGOLuck. "The United way is about getting the ball to you forwards as quickly as possible but United are slow on the ball and they get picked off.

"No matter the type of player they bring in they won’t be able to express themselves because they won’t get the balls in the right areas. Mason Mount has suffered because he doesn’t get the ball in areas, they need a player like Michael Carrick, Paul Scholes or Roy Keane to win the ball back and get it to the right players quickly.

"Casemiro has gone backwards and Kobbie Mainoo had a great season last yeat but he’s so young. Ten Hag is asking a young man to do a job that takes time to learn. United need one player in the six position who will always play the first pass forward and not sideways. That’s what United have been doing and it’s crap. It’s easy to play against."

Liverpool boss Arne Slot has defended the strategy of selling young players this summer. Slot is still yet to see a new recruit arrive at Anfield, but has lost a number of younger stars from his Reds squad.

"That's always a difficult one because young players want to play as well and if they want to develop they have to play. It's always like this. They come through the ranks of the youth academy," he said.

"Either then you're good enough to play for us many minutes or you're still not there, or there's too much competition in your position. I think still this team, with what we have, have a lot of homegrown players."

headline: Gary Neville's multi-millionaire net worth, rarely-seen wife and failed £8m Teletubbies house
body: Fans may know Gary Neville as the ex-Manchester United star and pundit, but the former defender has been involved in many ventures away from football and enjoys a fast-paced life with wife Emma
Whether it's for his football opinions or outspoken political views, Gary Neville is one of the most divisive and talked about pundits in the UK.

By the time he hung up his boots in February 2011, Neville was regarded as one of the most successful players in the history of English football. He started and ended his career with Manchester United, making 602 appearances while winning eight Premier League titles, three FA Cups and two Champions League trophies along the way.
Gary, 49, also played 85 times for the England national football team and was described by former Red Devils manager Sir Alex Ferguson as the "best right-back of his generation".

Today, he is a household name thanks to his regular punditry appearances on television. But with an astonishing net worth, various business ventures and a wife who stays out of the limelight, Mirror Sport looks to delve further into the unique life of the former footballer-turned-businessman.

Neville is well known in football circles for keeping himself extremely busy with all kinds of ventures ever since hanging up his boots. Neville’s 19-year football career for one of the biggest clubs in the world earned him significant money, but there are many other ways in which he has accrued his reported £70million net worth.

Today, the Bury-born entrepreneur is the majority owner of Salford City FC, having bought the club with other class of ‘92 alumni in 2014 and overseen their rise to League Two. He also has a huge business empire outside of football, getting into property development in his early 20s and now owning a chain of hotels and townhouses.

They include Hotel Football, which overlooks Old Trafford, as well as the Stock Exchange Hotel near Piccadilly Gardens. He is also involved in the St Michael’s Project, which aims to build apartments, hotels, offices and a high-end restaurant in Manchester’s city centre.

He founded investment company Relentless in 2015, which specialises in ventures across the Manchester area. Unsatisfied with all of the aforementioned roles, he likewise runs a property and construction consultancy firm named Zerum.

Neville is also a senior investor in E3 Creative, a digital creative agency which focuses on online marketing and corporate strategy. The ex-defender also invested in the hospitality sector with GG Hospitality and the higher education institution University Academy 92, which opened in September 2019 and offers "broader courses than traditional degrees" to the 400 students registered there as of 2022.

While many of the above are his pursuits away from the limelight, he is better known to the public for his long-standing roles as a football pundit for Sky Sports and ITV. In January 2024, he joined Dragon’s Den as one of its investors on the 21st series of the hit BBC show.

Neville’s hotel business alone has accumulated £20m in assets, according to Companies House, whilst his property development company has assets of £10.5m. His remaining businesses have combined assets of £40m. All the while, he is reportedly paid over £1m a year for his role on Sky.
Gary met his wife Emma Hadfield, from Middleton, Greater Manchester, in 2004, when she worked as a shop assistant in the city. Three years later, the pair tied the knot in a lavish ceremony.

The couple share teenage daughters Molly and Sophie, and lived in a mansion in Bolton, before making the move to Manchester city centre four years ago. In the early stages of their romance, Emma studied holistic therapy and is now a qualified counsellor and accredited 'Menopause Coach'.

The philanthropist launched her new support network online at the end of last year, where she teaches women about the menopause and gives advice and support to others on how best to navigate it. In a candid post and video, the mum-of-two shared that she had been diagnosed with early menopause soon after her most recent birthday – sending her on a course of education and self-discovery.

She now aims to share her wisdom with other women after qualifying as a counsellor in 2019. Gary, who has been in support of her latest project, wrote: "So proud of my wife Emma with the launch of her new community for women."

While other footballers sit back and enjoy pints of beer or turn to management after retirement, Neville came up with a master plan to build a futuristic carbon-neutral mansion in 2010, likened to the home seen in the children’s TV show Teletubbies.

Following a lengthy row with neighbours, his project – based in the Bolton suburb of Greater Manchester – received the green light in 2012 as Neville sought to build a dream home for himself, Emma and their two daughters. That was only possible after he ditched plans to build a 130ft wind turbine.

The house was going to be built into the ground and set over two floors but was never completed. The land sat empty for several years before the ex-England international abandoned building work in 2017.

He originally put the plot up for sale in 2020 for £650,000, with the 8,000 square foot site still including Neville's eco-friendly plans. Neville eventually had to reduce his asking price for the five bedroom property to £500,000.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Juventus open Jadon Sancho talks as PSG drop Manuel Ugarte hint
body: Manchester United are focusing on outgoings for the final six days of the summer transfer window, though the Red Devils remain keen on signing PSG midfielder Manuel Ugarte
There is now less than a week remaining of the summer transfer window and Manchester United's eyes are firmly on signing Manuel Ugarte.

Ugarte is free to leave PSG this summer, though the French giants are refusing to budge on their £51million valuation. United are keen to complete a deal for the midfielder, though they are also now focusing on outgoings.

At the top of the list of those heading out the exit door is Jadon Sancho, who does not appear to be in Erik ten Hag's plans. Juventus are the latest team to launch a move for the attacker, with PSG having also considered signing the former England international.

The news of those talks come as Gary Neville gave his seal of approval to the signing of Matthijs de Ligt, who arrived at Old Trafford earlier this summer. Here, Mirror Football rounds up all the latest Manchester United transfer news.

Juventus have opened talks over a move for Jadon Sancho, with Manchester United keen to move him on. Sancho was left out of the squad for the opening Premier League game of the season and had been linked with joining PSG.

But according to The Athletic, Juventus have now taken pole position in the race to sign the winger. The Serie A giants are in talks over a deal, though finding an agreement looks likely to prove difficult, with United holding out for a fee of £40m.

They are also unlikely to sanction another loan move, though that is exactly what Juve want to do. The Turin side have made him a top target and there is a sense United may agree to a loan deal if Juve agree full coverage of Sancho’s salary, plus a loan fee and an obligation to sign him permanently at the end of the loan.
United legend Gary Neville has topped Matthijs de Ligt to be the signing of the season. The Dutchman arrived just ahead of the win over Fulham, playing the final nine minutes of that match.

De Ligt is expected to quickly become a starter under Erik ten Hag once he settles in. And Neville believes he could go on to become a key player for United, so much so he can be the star signing of the summer.

Neville told Sky Sports: “I would like to think it’s going to be De Ligt. I would like to think De Ligt is going to be the best signing. I think these two (De Ligt and Neto) are going to have the most transformative impact on their teams. United have to go from eighth up to third or fourth, and Chelsea have to go from fifth.”

PSG have once again left Manuel Ugarte out of their squad for Friday's clash against Montpellier. Ugarte also missed their opening day win over Le Harve, with the French giants keen to see the midfielder leave.

United are his leading suitors, though talks remain ongoing with the two sides yet to reach an agreement over a fee. Boss Luis Enrique has made no secret of the fact that Ugarte is no longer in his plans, just a year after the Uruguayan arrived.

Enrique said PSG plan to "let go those we no longer count on." He added: "We have no priority, we already have a team that has been champion, we are watching the transfer window, we are looking to see if a player appears at a normal price but we will not make excessive expenditure."

headline: Man Utd set out new conditions for Jadon Sancho transfer exit after swap deal collapses
body: Manchester United have been attempting to sell Jadon Sancho for much of the summer, though a swap deal with PSG is now dead in the water with Juventus moving into pole position
Manchester United will only sanction a permanent departure for Jadon Sancho, having seen talks over a swap deal with PSG collapse earlier this summer.

Sancho was exiled by boss Erik ten Hag after a falling out last September, but was brought back into the fold in pre-season. But United have spent much of the transfer window attempting to move the Englishman on.

French giants PSG had looked his most likely destination, as part of a swap deal involving Manuel Ugarte. But such an agreement now appears to be dead in the water, though United are still pursuing Ugarte.
Instead, Juventus have now moved into pole position to sign Sancho. The Serie A giants have opened talks over a deal to bring the winger to Turin before the end of the window in six days time.

But according to The Athletic, a financial agreement that satisfies both teams is expected to be difficult to achieve. United are looking for a fee of £40million for the 24-year-old, though no suitors have so far shown a willingness to match that valuation.

Though they loaned Sancho out to Borussia Dortmund in January, the Red Devils are this time demanding a permanent sale only. Club chiefs would only consider another loan deal if it makes sense from a profit and sustainability view.

That would mean Juve fully cover Sancho’s salary, as well as pay a loan fee and include an obligation to sign him permanently in the deal. There is a belief that United would rather keep Sancho than let him leave on loan without significant financial benefit.

Despite being a distance from an agreement, Juventus are seen as being Sancho's most likely destination. The Serie A side are keen to sign two wingers before Friday's deadline, with sporting director Cristiano Giuntoli a fan of the Englishman.

Juve are expected to submit a loan offer with a salary-contribution deal but may well wait until the window’s final days to press for an agreement. Sancho was left out of the United squad for their opening day win over Fulham last week.
Boss Ten Hag stated an ear infection played some part in his absence, but it was a selection decision. The Dutchman clarified Sancho's future ahead of United's trip to Brighton on Saturday.

“I hope we will have a squad with double positioning and, when we go into the season after September 1 (with the transfer window closed), that means you can’t select all the players but you need them all throughout the season,” he said.

“We have to manage it, the attitude of the players is very important, sometimes they will be disappointed. They have to deal with it, you win as a squad. The prizes are decided next May, and until then we need all the players in the squad and highly motivated, that is not an expectation, that is a demand.”
